Recipe has already been shared with this user
Enter your first name, last name, email address and a password of your choice. Email address and password are required to create an account.
Your password must be between 8 and 16 characters. Your email address needs to contain an @ sign and a dot such as ".com"
When you have filled in your information, press \'Create Account\' to create an account.
Here you can collect all of your favorite recipes, refer to them for cooking, and share them with your friends!

Here you can view all of your recipes. The menu on the top-right allows you to switch between viewing all recipes, only recipes that you have created personally and recipes that have been shared with you by your friends.
The search bar on the top allows you to search your recipes for specific ingredients and categories.
Click on one of the recipes to view the recipe.
This page shows you all the details of the recipe.
The toggle button on the top allows you to switch between viewing your recipe in the US and the Metric measurement system.
The Edit option under the Options Menu allows you to edit your recipe.
Create a new recipe by filling in the fields below and clicking Save under the Options Menu.

The recipe name field and the first three ingredient fields are required fields. Only ingredients that are suggested by the ingredient input fields are allowed. Ingredients are not required to have a quantity and quantity unit associated with them. However, if a quantity is entered for an ingredient, then that ingredient also needs a quantity unit assigned to it. The quantity unit \'ct\' stands for count and can be used for ingredients that cannot be broken up, such as eggs. The primary category field is a required field. Any additional categories are optional. Any fields located after the category section are also optional.
Click on the round button on the bottom left to edit the recipe. Click on New Ingredient to add an ingredient to choose from and click on New Category to expand the categories you can choose from.
